description: A power supply on the sending device has failed. The
entPhysicalDescr object identifies the failed supply.
A textual description of physical entity. This object
should contain a string that identifies the manufacturer's
name for the physical entity, and should be set to a
distinct value for each version or model of the physical
entity.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalDescr

description: A power supply on the sending device has recovered
after failure. The entPhysicalDescr object identifies
the recovered supply.
A textual description of physical entity. This object
should contain a string that identifies the manufacturer's
name for the physical entity, and should be set to a
distinct value for each version or model of the physical
entity.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalDescr

description: A Fan tray on the sending device has failed. The
entPhysicalDescr object identifies the failed fan tray.
A textual description of physical entity. This object
should contain a string that identifies the manufacturer's
name for the physical entity, and should be set to a
distinct value for each version or model of the physical
entity.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalDescr

description: A Fan tray on the sending device has recovered
after failure. The entPhysicalDescr object identifies
the recovered Fan tray.
A textual description of physical entity. This object
should contain a string that identifies the manufacturer's
name for the physical entity, and should be set to a
distinct value for each version or model of the physical
entity.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalDescr

description: A temperature inside the chassis on the sending device has exceeded
normal operating temperature. The entPhysicalDescr object
identifies the module that has the temperature sensor.

event.Summary: Temperature is outside normal operating range

description: A textual description of physical entity. This object
should contain a string that identifies the manufacturer's
name for the physical entity, and should be set to a
distinct value for each version or model of the physical
entity.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalDescr

description: A temperature inside the chassis on the sending device has returned
to normal operating temperature. The entPhysicalDescr
object identifies the module that has the temperature sensor.

event.Summary: Temperature is within normal operating range

description: A textual description of physical entity. This object
should contain a string that identifies the manufacturer's
name for the physical entity, and should be set to a
distinct value for each version or model of the physical
entity.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalDescr

description: A module has been inserted into the chassis. The object
entPhysicalDescr identifies the module. The module can be a card
for the main bay or a switching fabric in the switching fabric
bay.

event.Summary: Module has been inserted into the chassis

description: A textual description of physical entity. This object
should contain a string that identifies the manufacturer's
name for the physical entity, and should be set to a
distinct value for each version or model of the physical
entity.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalDescr

description: A module has been turned off or removed from the chassis. The
object entPhysicalDescr identifies the module. The module can be
a card for the main bay or a switching fabric in the switching
fabric.

event.Summary: Module has been turned off or removed from the chassis

description: A textual description of physical entity. This object
should contain a string that identifies the manufacturer's
name for the physical entity, and should be set to a
distinct value for each version or model of the physical
entity.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalDescr

description: A backup control module that was in standby mode has taken over
for a failed primary control module. The objec entPhysicalDescr
identifies the now active control module.

event.Summary: Control module has failed over; $v1 is now active

description: A textual description of physical entity. This object
should contain a string that identifies the manufacturer's
name for the physical entity, and should be set to a
distinct value for each version or model of the physical
entity.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalDescr

description: The primary switching fabric that was in standby mode has failed.
The object entPhysicalDescr identifies the failed switching
fabric. If there is a backup switching fabric and if it comes up
ok, rsEnvirSwitchingFabricFailover would be sent after this one.
A textual description of physical entity. This object
should contain a string that identifies the manufacturer's
name for the physical entity, and should be set to a
distinct value for each version or model of the physical
entity.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalDescr

description: A backup switching fabric that was in standby mode has taken over
for a failed primary switching fabric. The object entPhysicalDescr
identifies the now active switching fabric. This would be sent
after sending rsEnvirSwitchingFabricFailure.

event.Summary: Primary switching fabric has failed over

description: A textual description of physical entity. This object
should contain a string that identifies the manufacturer's
name for the physical entity, and should be set to a
distinct value for each version or model of the physical
entity.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalDescr

description: A temperature inside the chassis on the sending device has fallen
below normal operating temperature. The entPhysicalDescr object
identifies the module that has the temperature sensor.

event.Summary: Temperature is outside normal operating range

description: A textual description of physical entity. This object
should contain a string that identifies the manufacturer's
name for the physical entity, and should be set to a
distinct value for each version or model of the physical
entity.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalDescr

description: A backup control module that was in standby mode has taken over
for a failed primary control module. The objec entPhysicalDescr
identifies the now active control module.
Name of the software module that is generating this syslog message.
variables.name: RIVERSTONE-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::rsS2SModuleId

description: Severity of the event that caused the syslog message to be generated.
variables.name: RIVERSTONE-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::rsS2SSeverity

description: Text message describing the event that resulted in the syslog
message being generated. Any instance identifiers will be
embedded in this message text.
variables.name: RIVERSTONE-NOTIFICATIONS-MIB::rsS2SMessage
